name: maize starch production | maize starch | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/1079/documentation

This dataset represents the production of 1 kg of maize starch with a water content of 14% by weight.;[This dataset was already contained in the ecoinvent database version 2. It was not individually updated during the transfer to ecoinvent version 3. Life Cycle Impact Assessment results may still have changed, as they are affected by changes in the supply chain, i.e. in other datasets. This dataset was generated following the ecoinvent quality guidelines for version 2. It may have been subject to central changes described in the ecoinvent version 3 change report (http://www.ecoinvent.org/database/ecoinvent-version-3/reports-of-changes/), and the results of the central updates were reviewed extensively. The changes added e.g. consistent water flows and other information throughout the database. The documentation of this dataset can be found in the ecoinvent reports of version 2, which are still available via the ecoinvent website. The change report linked above covers all central changes that were made during the conversion process.]

From reception of the maize grain at the factory gate.

This activity ends with the production of starch from maize. This dataset includes the production steps required to obtain maize starch from maize corns such as mechanical separation, swelling in process water, milling of the swelled corns, desiccation and drying of the extracted starch. Processing of process water and infrastructure use were included. This dataset doesn't include emissions to air and waste generation as no data related to these emissions was found.
category: C:Manufacturing/10:Manufacture of food products/106:Manufacture of grain mill products, starches and starch products/1062:Manufacture of starches and starch products

processDocumentation.timeDescription: Year when the data for this inventory was delivered.
processDocumentation.geographyDescription: Values refer to the situation in Germany.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Refers to typical maize starch production in Germany. This technology includes the following manufacturing steps: mechanical separation of impurities; soaking of the maize grains for about 40 hours in 50 °C warm process water; milling of the soaked maize and separation of the germ. The germ is dried and pressed into corn oil; mechanical separation of starch from other components; mechanical desiccation and thermal drying of the extracted starch to obtain a final product with a maximum water content of 14% by weight; evaporation of the process water to obtain the by-products of maize such as gluten and maize-gluten feed.;;References;Würdinger E., Roth U., Wegener A. & Peche R. (2003) Kunststoffe aus Nachwachsenden Rohstoffen: Vergleichende Ökobilanz für Loose-fill-Packmittel aus Stärke bzw. aus Polystyrol". Final report. BIfA, IFEU, Flo-Pak (eds.), Projektförderung: Deutsche Bundesstiftung Umwelt; Augsburg, März 2003, 514 p.
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: Maize production in Germany approximated by Swiss data.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: Data based on a detailed literature study.
